snippet: A newspaper recounted January maneuvers, involving nighttime advances on New Delhi, that it said had taken the government by surprise.
abstract: India’s top leaders deny a rift between the country’s civilian government and its military brass after an article in a leading national newspaper described a tense episode in January in which civilian leaders became deeply unnerved when two army units advanced on the capital of New Delhi in an unannounced nighttime drill; defense ministry describes exercises as routine.

byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and HARI KUMAR
